2D Models#

class pystoms.models.AbstractModel(*args, **kwargs)#

Wrapper class providing methods

This class is a subclass of pymc3.Model and super class of implemented models. It is supposed to provide with methods for sampling, evaluation and prior/posterior analysis. These methods use the pymc3 functions for this purpose.

This class is not supposed to be used externally.

evaluation(prior_pred: bool = False, post_pred: bool = False, post_sample_n: int = 100, save_fig: bool = False, path_output_dir: str = 'Evaluation')#

Evaluation of model

Evaluates model by comparison of infered values to original syntheticPeptideFeature parameters. Optionally, prior and posterior predictive checks can be performed.

Parameters

  • prior_pred (bool, optional) – If True, prior predictive check is performed. Defaults to False.

  • post_pred (bool, optional) – If True, posterior predictive check is performed. Defaults to False.

  • post_sample_n (int, optional) – Number of samples (per chain) to draw for posterior predictive check. Defaults to 100.

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – If true, generated figures and data is stored, not printed to console. Defaults to False.

  • path_output_dir (str, optional) – relative path of folder to store output in. Defaults to “Evaluation”.

Raises

  • ValueError – If model has no connected syntheticPeptideFeature.

  • NameError – If model has no modelname.

Returns

Summary of model fit.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

posteriorAnalysis(post_sample_n: int = 100, save_fig: bool = False, path_output_dir: str = 'Evaluation')#

Performs posterior predictive check using pymc3 and arviz.

Parameters

  • post_sample_n (int, optional) – Number samples to draw from posterior (per chain). Defaults to 100.

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – If True, plot is saved to png. Defaults to False.

  • path_output_dir (str, optional) – Relative path for output. Defaults to “Evaluation”.

Raises

NameError – If model has no name.

priorAnalysis(save_fig: bool = False, path_output_dir: str = 'Evaluation')#

Perform prior predictive check using pymc3 and arviz.

Parameters

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – If True, plot is exported to png. Defaults to False.

  • path_output_dir (str, optional) – Path to folder to store file in. Defaults to “Evaluation”.

Raises

NameError – If model has no name.

sample(save_to_file: bool = False, path_output_dir: str = 'TraceData')#

Uses pm.sample to sample trace

Parameters

  • save_to_file (bool, optional) – If True, trace is stored in .nc format. Defaults to False.

  • path_output_dir (str, optional) – Relative path to folder where to store trace data. Defaults to “TraceData”.

class pystoms.models.ModelChargeAveragineIsotopicPattern(*args, **kwargs)#

Model for Isotopic pattern.

Fitting normal mixture distribution to mass to charge ratios (\(mz\)). Instances of this class also estimate charge \(z\) and averagine model parameter \(λ_{a}\).

This model allows for inference of peptide mass \(m\), charge \(z\) standard deviation σ of normal distributions around peaks and \(λ_{a}\) of averagine model. Note, that charge \(z\) is represented by charge state \(z'\).

\(z=z'+1\)

Model design:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}&obs ∼ \mathrm{NormalMixture}(\vec{w},\vec{μ},\vec{σ})\\&\vec{w} = f'_{A}(mz*(z'+1),λ_{a})\\&μ_{i} = mz+\frac{i}{z'+1}, i ∈ \{0,1,...,n-1\}\\&σ_{i} ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{σ_{iso}}\right)\\&mz ∼ \mathrm{Normal}(μ_{m},σ_{m})\\&z' ∼ \mathrm{Poisson}(z_{start})\\&λ_{a} ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{\hat{λ_{a}}}\right)\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

With weights of normal mixture distribution \(\vec{w}\) set by averagine model \(f'_{A}\). Here, also taking \(λ_{a}\) as parameter. Positions of normal mixture model \(\vec{μ}\) are set to monoisotopic mz \(\frac{m}{z'+1}\) and \(n-1\) first isotopic peaks. For all normal distributions of mixture the same standard deviation \(σ_{i}\) is used. Hyperpriors \(μ_{m},σ_{m},σ_{iso},z_{start},\hat{λ_{a}}\) can be passed to constructor. If no hyperpriors are provided, \(μ_{m}\) is set to mean of observed mz values. \(σ_{m},σ_{iso}\) default to 1 and 0.1, respectively. \(z_{start}\) defaults to 2. \(\hat{λ_{a}}\) defaults to 0.01.

mz#

Monoisotopic peptide mass to charge ratio.

Type

pm.Normal

sigma#

Widths of normal distributions of mixture.

Type

pm.Exponential

obs#

Normal mixture distribution.

Type

pm.NormalMixture

charge_state#

Charge state of peptide. Charge of peptide is charge_state+1.

Type

pm.Poisson

λ_a#

Factor of averagine model. (\(λ=λ_{a}*m+0.03091\))

Type

pm.Exponential

class pystoms.models.ModelChargeIsotopicPattern(*args, **kwargs)#

Model for Isotopic pattern.

Fitting normal mixture distribution to mass to charge ratios (\(mz\)). Instances of this class also estimate charge \(z\) but not averagine model parameter \(λ_{a}\).

This model allows for inference of peptide mass \(m\), charge \(z\) and standard deviation σ of normal distributions around peaks. Note, that charge \(z\) is represented by charge state \(z'\).

\(z=z'+1\)

Model design:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}&obs ∼ \mathrm{NormalMixture}(\vec{w},\vec{μ},\vec{σ})\\&\vec{w} = f_{A}(mz*(z'+1))\\&μ_{i} = mz+\frac{i}{z'+1}, i ∈ \{0,1,...,n-1\}\\&σ_{i} ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(1/σ_{iso}\right)\\&mz ∼ \mathrm{Normal}(μ_{m},σ_{m})\\&z' ∼ \mathrm{Poisson}(z_{start})\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

With weights of normal mixture distribution \(\vec{w}\) set by averagine model \(f_{A}\). Positions of normal mixture model \(\vec{μ}\) are set to monoisotopic mz \(\frac{m}{z'+1}\) and \(n-1\) first isotopic peaks. For all normal distributions of mixture the same standard deviation \(σ_{i}\) is used. Hyperpriors \(μ_{m},σ_{m},σ_{iso},z_{start}\) can be passed to constructor. If no hyperpriors are provided, \(μ_{m}\) is set to mean of observed mz values. \(σ_{m},σ_{iso}\) default to 1 and 0.1, respectively. \(z_{start}\) defaults to 2.

mz#

Monoisotopic peptide mass to charge value.

Type

pm.Normal

sigma#

Widths of normal distributions of mixture.

Type

pm.Exponential

obs#

Normal mixture distribution.

Type

pm.NormalMixture

charge_state#

Charge state of peptide. Charge of peptide is charge_state+1.

Type

pm.Poisson

class pystoms.models.ModelChargePoissonIsotopicPattern(*args, **kwargs)#

Model for Isotopic pattern.

Fitting normal mixture distribution to mass to charge ratios (\(mz\)). Instances of this class also estimate charge \(z\) and expected/average count of isotopes in molecule \(λ\).

This model allows for inference of peptide mass \(m\), charge \(z\) standard deviation σ of normal distributions around peaks and \(λ\), the average count of isotopic atoms inside the molecule behind the observed feature. Note, that charge \(z\) is represented by charge state \(z'\).

\(z=z'+1\)

Model design:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}&obs ∼ \mathrm{NormalMixture}(\vec{w},\vec{μ},\vec{σ})\\&w_{i} = \frac{\mathrm{PoissonPDF(i|λ)}}{\sum_{j=0}^{n-1}\mathrm{PoissonPDF(j|λ)}}, i ∈ \{0,1,...,n-1\}\\&μ_{i} = mz+\frac{i}{z'+1}, i ∈ \{0,1,...,n-1\}\\&σ_{i} ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{σ_{iso}}\right)\\&mz ∼ \mathrm{Normal}(μ_{m},σ_{m})\\&z' ∼ \mathrm{Poisson}(z_{start})\\&λ ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{\hat{λ}}\right)\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

Positions of normal mixture model \(\vec{μ}\) are set to monoisotopic mz \(\frac{m}{z'+1}\) and \(n-1\) first isotopic peaks. For all normal distributions of mixture the same standard deviation \(σ_{i}\) is used. Hyperpriors \(μ_{m},σ_{m},σ_{iso},z_{start},\hat{λ}\) can be passed to constructor. If no hyperpriors are provided, \(μ_{m}\) is set to mean of observed mz values. \(σ_{m},σ_{iso}\) default to 1 and 0.1, respectively. \(z_{start}\) defaults to 2. \(\hat{λ}\) defaults to averagine assumption \(0.000594 * μ_{m}*(z_{start}+1) - 0.03091\).

mz#

Monoisotopic peptide mass to charge ratio.

Type

pm.Normal

sigma#

Widths of normal distributions of mixture.

Type

pm.Exponential

obs#

Normal mixture distribution. Model for observed mass to charge ratios.

Type

pm.NormalMixture

charge_state#

Charge state of peptide. Charge of peptide is charge_state+1.

Type

pm.Poisson

λ#

λ of Poisson distribution behind normal mixture weights. Expected isotopic atoms in molecule.

Type

pm.Exponential

class pystoms.models.ModelEMG(*args, **kwargs)#

Model for peptide elution profile.

Fitting exponentially modified gaussian distribution (EMG) to retention times (\(rt\)). Inference of EMG parameters \(μ,σ,λ\).

Model design:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}&rt ∼ \mathrm{EMG}(μ,σ,λ)\\&μ ∼ \mathrm{Normal}\left(\hat{μ},\hat{σ}\right)\\&σ ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{\hat{σ}}\right)\\&λ ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{\hat{λ}}\right)\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

With \(\hat{μ},\hat{σ}\) defaulting to the mean and standard deviation of the passed retention time data, respectively. \(\hat{λ}\) defaults to 1.

emg_μ#

Location of EMG distribution.

Type

pm.Normal

emg_σ#

Width of EMG distribution.

Type

pm.Exponential

emg_λ#

Tailing of EMG distribution.

Type

pm.Exponential

obs#

EMG distribution.

Type

pm.ExGaussian

class pystoms.models.ModelIsotopicPattern(*args, **kwargs)#

Model for Isotopic pattern.

Fitting normal mixture distribution to mass to charge ratios (\(mz\)). Instances of this class do not estimate charge \(z\) nor averagine model parameter \(λ_{a}\). Charge (\(z\)) of peptide must be provided. Data is transformed for fit:

\(m=mz*z\)

This model allows for inference of peptide mass \(m\) and standard deviation \(σ\) of normal distributions around mass peaks.

Model design:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}&mz*z ∼ \mathrm{NormalMixture}\left(\vec{w},\vec{μ},\vec{σ}\right)\\&\vec{w} = f_{A}(m,n)\\&μ_{i} = m+i, i ∈ \{0,1,...,n-1\}\\&σ_{i} ∼ \mathrm{Exponential}\left(\frac{1}{σ_{iso}}\right)\\&m ∼ \mathrm{Normal}(μ_{m},σ_{m})\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

With weights of normal mixture distribution \(\vec{w}\) set by averagine model \(f_{A}\). Positions of normal mixture model \(\vec{μ}\) are set to monoisotopic mass \(m\) and \(n-1\) first isotopic peaks. For all normal distributions of mixture the same standard deviation \(σ_{i}\) is used. Hyperpriors \(μ_{m},σ_{m},σ_{iso}\) can be passed to constructor. If no hyperpriors are provided, \(μ_{m}\) is set to mean of observed masses. \(σ_{m},σ_{iso}\) default to 1 and 0.1, respectively.

mass#

Monoisotopic peptide mass.

Type

pm.Normal

sigma#

Widths of normal distributions of mixture.

Type

pm.Exponential

obs#

Normal mixture distribution.

Type

pm.NormalMixture
